business.headline: India, EU mega trade deal near finish line with phased tariff cuts: Maros SefcovicAutomobiles have long been one of the toughest chapters in the India–EU free trade negotiations. European carmakers have sought lower import duties and clearer rules to expand their footprint in India, while New Delhi has remained cautious, wary of exposing domestic manufacturers to sudden competition.

India set to become 3rd-largest economy, but why is per capita income still low?Every time India moves up the global GDP ranks, the per capita income question resurfaces. Looking at both together shows a truer picture than letting one overshadow the other.

Explained: Why EU leaders' India visit matters for the mega trade dealBy linking one of the world's fastest-growing major economies with a bloc that remains a central pillar of global trade, the deal would reshape supply-chain flows at a time when governments are rethinking their economic dependencies.

IndiGo's 10% flight curbs kick in, Centre redistributes slots to airlinesIndia's aviation sector is witnessing a strategic reshuffle as the government redistributes 10 per cent of IndiGo's flight operations to other domestic carriers. This phased approach aims to balance capacity while ensuring passenger convenience and connectivity.

Why most Indians are still underinsured despite buying insuranceSeveral insurer-backed studies show that a large share of Indian policyholders have life cover of less than five times their annual income. Most financial planners recommend at least 10 to 15 times annual income, and often more.

Will AI kill jobs across the globe and how can India ride the AI wave? Experts weigh inIn this India Today special show from the World Economic Forum in Davos, top artificial intelligence innovators share their perspectives on the global AI race, AI's impact on the Indian economy and much more.

From income protection to easier credit: What gig workers expect from Budget 2026Delivery partners, drivers and freelancers form the backbone of India's fast-growing gig economy, yet financial security remains fragile for many. As Budget 2026 approaches, gig workers are hoping for measures that offer income protection, smoother credit access and faster support during emergencies.

Gold shines at record highs: What should investors do now?With gold touching new lifetime highs, the metal has once again proved its role as a refuge in uncertain times. But for investors, the rally raises a key question: what is the right move at current levels? Let's have a look.

Are personal loans becoming the go-to option during medical emergencies?A sudden medical emergency can quickly turn into a financial crisis. With healthcare costs rising and insurance cover often falling short, many Indian families are increasingly turning to personal loans to bridge the gap.

Sensex sinks 770 points, Nifty tumbles as FII selling hits sentiment hardMarkets slipped sharply as foreign investor selling, sector-wide pressure and a weakening rupee crushed sentiment. With Nifty near a key support zone, the next few sessions could set the tone for February.

Sensex down nearly 800 points at closing: Why stock market fell todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 769.67 points at 81,537.70 and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 241.25 points to 25,048.65.

Sebi accuses PwC and EY executives in Yes Bank's 2022 share sale: ReportIn total, 19 individuals have been accused of insider trading violations. Seven are alleged to have traded using privileged information, while four are accused of sharing it.

Can Budget 2026 help make insurance more affordable for Indians?With healthcare costs rising and insurance still out of reach for many, Budget 2026 is being closely watched by households and insurers alike. Industry leaders believe the right tax and policy moves could make insurance more affordable for millions.

French President's viral Davos shades give iVision Tech a 38 crore stock boostFrench President Emmanuel Macron's look during his World Economic Forum speech went viral online and the market reacted instantly.

From easier credit to insurance: What MSMEs want from Union Budget 2026As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, MSMEs are looking for practical support to ease everyday financial pressures. Industry leaders say better access to credit, lower insurance costs and simpler rules could help small businesses grow with confidence.

Is Rs 50,000 salary enough to invest? Sebi advisor explains what actually worksFinancial advisors say this income level is enough to begin building a long-term portfolio, provided the focus remains on discipline, safety and clear financial goals.

IndiGo share price down 4% after Q3 results: Buy, sell or hold?IndiGo share price: The stock slipped as much as 3.9% during early trade to hit an intraday low of Rs 4,723.60. It later recovered part of the losses but continued to trade in the red.

Gold and silver hit new highs again. Should you still buy?While the domestic trend remains sharply bullish, experts say understanding the broader backdrop can help investors think about why the rally is persisting and what it could mean for portfolios this year.

Infosys to hire 20,000 graduates in FY27 as AI demand surges: ReportInfosys is gearing up for heavier AI workloads in 2026 and beyond, and the scale of its campus hiring shows where the company believes client spending is beginning to stabilise and grow.
Sensex, Nifty open in green over improved global cues; TCS up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 77.47 points to 82,384.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 31.95 points to 25,321.85 as of 9:24 am.

entertainment.headline: This is not just my achievement: Prosenjit Chatterjee on Padam Shri Actor Prosenjit Chatterjee receives the Padma Shri at the 2026 Padma Awards. The honour recognises his four decades of versatile contributions to Bengali cinema and Indian culture.

Everyone wanted this for him: Hema Malini on Dharmendra's Padma Vibhushan Actor Dharmendra was posthumously awarded the Padma Vibhushan in 2026. His family and fans celebrate the honour while mourning his absence at the ceremony.

Very honoured and humbled: R Madhavan on receiving Padma Shri R. Madhavan expressed gratitude after receiving the Padma Shri at the Padma Awards 2026. Other entertainment honourees include Dharmendra, Alka Yagnik, Mammootty, and Prosenjit Chatterjee.

So so proud: Hema Malini celebrates Dharmendra's posthumous Padma Vibhushan honour Hema Malini posted on social media to express her pride in the government's decision to posthumously honour her husband Dharmendra with Padma Vibhushan, calling it a recognition of his immense contribution to Indian cinema.

Padma Vibhushan for Dharmendra; Mammootty, Alka Yagnik receive Padma Bhushan The Padma Awards 2026 have been announced. Dharmendra has been honoured with Padma Vibhushan, while Alka Yagnik and Mammootty received Padma Bhushan. Prosenjit Chatterjee, R Madhavan, Satish Shah and Anil Rastogi are recipients of Padma Shri for contribution to Indian cinema and music.

Olive branch out? Beckhams reportedly ready to reconcile with Brooklyn David and Victoria Beckham are open to welcoming their son Brooklyn back into the family following a public dispute, according to sources. The family is said to be saddened by the estrangement, as communication between Brooklyn, his wife Nicola, and the Beckhams reportedly takes place only through mediators.

Won't bow to pressure: Vijay Thalapathy amid Jana Nayagan censor row Actor and TVK president Vijay launches party symbol at Mahabalipuram while awaiting High Court verdict on his film's release and under scrutiny for the Karur stampede.

Is Yuzvendra Chahal dating Bigg Boss 13 fame Shefali Bagga? Here's what we know A recent video featuring cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and Shefali Bagga has triggered renewed speculation about Chahal's personal life, especially amid reports of him and RJ Mahvash unfollowing each other on social media.

Odia music icon Abhijit Majumdar dies at 54 after battling chronic health issues Abhijit Majumdar, acclaimed Odia singer and composer, died at AIIMS Bhubaneswar on Sunday after complications from refractory septic shock. He was 54. Majumdar's death follows a prolonged battle with multiple health conditions. T

Mankatha re-release row: Chennai theatre owner condemns reckless fan behaviour A Chennai theatre owner has condemned the actions of Ajith Kumar fans who burst crackers inside a theatre during the screening of the film Mankatha.

Border 2: Sunny Deol meets war hero's family, calls experience warm and memorable Actor Sunny Deol recently met the family of Param Vir Chakra hero Nirmal Jit Singh Sekhon, highlighting Border 2's tribute to real-life bravery. Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh portrays the war hero in this patriotic film.

Victoria, David Beckham revisit old memories as tension with son Brooklyn lingers David and Victoria Beckham reflected on cherished moments with their eldest son, Brooklyn. The couple shared a warm public exchange on social media as they navigate ongoing family tensions.

Lollapalooza India Day 1: Yungblud, Fujii Kaze, Playboi Carti storm Mumbai Yungblud's explosive set, Fujii Kaze's soulful calm and Playboi Carti's riotous energy dominated Mumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse. From hip-hop chaos to synth nostalgia, Day 1 delivered unforgettable performances and pop culture mayhem at Lollapalooza India.

Dissent is patriotic: Nayanthara's fierce first look from Mammootty's Patriot out The makers of Patriot have released the first look poster of Nayanthara. It showcases her in a serious avatar alongside the tagline 'Dissent is patriotic'. The film, directed by Mahesh Narayanan, features a star-studded cast and is slated for release in 2026.

Oscars under fire: Natalie Portman calls out snub of women-directed films Natalie Portman spoke out against the Academy for the lack of recognition for women-directed films in the latest Oscar nominations. She was speaking out at Sundance during her film The Gallerist premiere.

Hrithik Roshan attends Goldie Behl's birthday bash on crutches, no photo-op Actor Hrithik Roshan attended Goldie Behl's birthday celebration while walking on crutches. The actor avoided posing for paparazzi, sparking concern and curiosity among fans.

False and outrageous: Palaash serves Rs 10 crore defamation notice to Sangli man Music composer Palaash Muchhal has initiated legal action against Sangli-based actor-producer Vidnyan Mane. The move came following allegations of financial fraud related to a film investment and cheating accusations involving cricketer Smriti Mandhana.

Why Sunny Deol's superstardom is unique: Betaab to Border 2 via Ghayal and Gadar Sunny Deol's ability to return with the right film at the right time lets him tide over stretches of forgettable releases. Border 2 is the latest instance.

Border 2 box office day 2: Sunny Deol film dominates Republic Day weekend Sunny Deol's Border 2 performed better than Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar on its second day at the box office. The film is solidifying its status as the biggest tentpole release of 2026 so far.

general news.headline: Padma Vibhushan for Dharmendra posthumously, Padma Shri for Rohit Sharma. Full ListThe Padma Awards 2026 list includes 19 women awardees, six foreigners or persons of Indian origin abroad, and 16 posthumous honours. The awards span diverse fields such as art, public affairs, medicine, literature and education, sports, science and engineering, social work, civil service, and trade and industry.

10,000 kg of explosive material seized from Rajasthan farmhouse on R-Day eveRajasthan Police have made a significant breakthrough by arresting a man and seizing nearly 10,000 kg of explosives linked to illegal mining in Nagaur district. The operation exposes a large smuggling network and ongoing investigations aim to dismantle the entire chain.

BJP, Trinamool workers vandalise each other's events in KolkataClashes between the Bharatiya Janata Party and All India Trinamool Congress erupted in Kolkata, leading to vandalism and arson at rival political events.

Shaurya Chakra citation reveals details of Army's covert Myanmar Op in July 2025A Shaurya Chakra citation has, for the first time, formally acknowledged an Indian Army covert operation in Myanmar in July 2025.

If 40 is the new layoff age, is it also India's new retirement age?The new middle-class nightmare isn't recession but redundancy at 40. It takes one call, one email, one "restructuring", and your peak earning years are wiped out. It is true, India is creating a 20-year gap where people are neither employed nor retired, just stuck in survival mode.

India, Europe showing another way in fractured world: EU Chief arrives in DelhiEuropean Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's visit to India marks a significant step in deepening India-EU ties. The focus is on strategic partnership, trade, technology, and global cooperation to address contemporary challenges.

Bangladesh textile mills claim Indian yarn flooding market, warn of shutdownBangladesh's textile millers have warned of a nationwide shutdown from February 1 if duty-free yarn imports, largely from India, are not withdrawn, citing huge losses, gas shortages and mill closures.

T20 World Cup defence loading? India obliterate New Zealand to seal seriesIndia laid down a T20 World Cup marker as Abhishek Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav powered an 8-wicket win over New Zealand in Guwahati.

What a view: US Rock climber scales Taiwan's 508-metre Taipei 101 without harnessHonnold's free solo climb of the iconic building in Taiwan's capital city was broadcast live on Netflix with a 10-second delay.

Took Rs 3 lakh, sister's UPSC fees, ran to Goa: Teen says exams were too stressfulA 17-year-old Vadodara student fled home with Rs 3 lakh amid exam stress, sparking a multi-state police search. He was found safe in Goa and revealed he needed a break from academic pressure.

India stands for peace even as world faces conflict: President Murmu on Republic Day evePresident Droupadi Murmu, in her address to the nation on the eve of the 77th Republic Day, emphasised India's progress in digital leadership, economic growth, and gender equality, while calling for inclusive development and national unity.

Dear parents, it's not cute when your child screams in publicHandcrafted ByOur Editors Children screaming in public and throwing tantrums have become a common sight in India. Parents typically resort to electronic devices to handle their little ones, which doesn't have the best success rate. Or in many cases, turn a blind eye. The result is unchecked chaos in public spaces, ruining others' happy moments. But who or what is responsible – bad parenting, tired parents or chronic poor civic culture in India?

Padma Vibhushan for Dharmendra; Mammootty, Alka Yagnik receive Padma BhushanThe Padma Awards 2026 have been announced. Dharmendra has been honoured with Padma Vibhushan, while Alka Yagnik and Mammootty received Padma Bhushan. Prosenjit Chatterjee, R Madhavan, Satish Shah and Anil Rastogi are recipients of Padma Shri for contribution to Indian cinema and music.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

Indian Air Force began a fighter jet hunt 2 decades ago. It's finally nearing an endHandcrafted ByOur Editors India is reportedly in the last stages of clearing and signing an agreement with France to purchase 114 additional Rafale fighter jets for the Air Force. The deal, if it goes through, would mark the conclusion of a fighter jet hunt that the Indian Air Force began nearly two decades ago.

Col Sofiya Qureshi, who led Op Sindoor briefing, among Vishisht Seva Medal awardeesIndian Army officer Sofia Qureshi has been honoured with the Vishisht Seva Medal for her exemplary leadership and service. This recognition highlights the armed forces' commitment to professional excellence and the increasing role of women in command positions.

Fresh western disturbance to chill Republic Day across North IndiaIndia faces a fresh Western Disturbance tomorrow bringing snow to the mountains and fog to the plains. The IMD warns of cold wave conditions and squally winds across several northern states.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Who is Shubhanshu Shukla and why has he been awarded Ashoka Chakra?Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is the first Indian astronaut to receive the Ashoka Chakra. Discover his journey from Lucknow to the International Space Station.

Nasa imagery shows Kamchatka buried in record snow apocalypseA series of intense winter storms fuelled by a distorted polar vortex has buried Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula under record-breaking snow. Satellite imagery from Nasa reveals the scale of the whiteout that has brought the volcanic region to a standstill.

Meet the IAF officer attending the Republic Day flag hoisting with the PresidentOn January 26, when the Tricolour rises at Kartavya Path, a young Indian Air Force officer will stand beside the President of India, marking a moment of national pride and personal achievement shaped by years of training and quiet dedication.

Enough justice: Sanju Samson trolled brutally after poor form continues in 3rd T20IIND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Sanju Samson scored a golden duck after Matt Henry dismissed him in the third T20I on Sunday at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati. Samson has averaged only 17 in his last 18 T20I innings.

India set to become 3rd-largest economy, but why is per capita income still low?Every time India moves up the global GDP ranks, the per capita income question resurfaces. Looking at both together shows a truer picture than letting one overshadow the other.

sports.headline: IND vs NZ, Stat Wrap: India show no mountain is too high to climb after Guwahati epic IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I statwrap: Abhishek Sharma's explosive knock powered India to a dominant win over New Zealand, sealing the series in record-setting fashion as multiple milestones fell in one of the fastest chases in T20 history.

IS Bindra, former BCCI President, dies at 84 after prolonged illness Former BCCI and Punjab Cricket Association chief IS Bindra, a pioneer who helped transform Indian cricket into a billion-dollar industry, passed away at 84 on Sunday, January 25.

New-ball or death specialist? Jasprit Bumrah opens up on flexible bowling challenges IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Jasprit Bumrah was impressive in the third T20I against New Zealand, winning the Player of the Match award with figures of 4-0-17-3 at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati.

Yuvraj Singh pokes fun at Abhishek Sharma after missing his T20I record in Guwahati IND vs NZ: Abhishek Sharma's blistering 13-ball fifty in Guwahati thrilled fans but left Yuvraj Singh's 12-ball T20I record intact. The former India star responded with a playful tweet, praising the youngster while reminding him who still owns the landmark.

Hardik Pandya shows elite mindset, straight back to nets after T20I series victory IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Hardik Pandya went straight to the nets for some batting practice after India sealed the series against New Zealand with an eight-wicket win in Guwahati. Hardik had an excellent day with the ball after taking the wickets of Rachin Ravindra and Daryl Mitchell.

Padma Awards for Sports Icons: Rohit Sharma, Harmanpreet Kaur, Vijay Amritraj Honoured On this Special Report, India Today's Harshad Ahuja discusses the prestigious Padma Awards conferred upon Indian sporting icons. Cricketers Rohit Sharma and Harmanpreet Kaur are set to receive the Padma Shri, while tennis legend Vijay Amritraj will be honoured with the Padma Bhushan. Harshad Ahuja notes that 'Harmanpreet Kaur becoming the first women Indian captain to go on and end that jinx, get India that first ever World Cup' was a historic milestone achieved in Navi Mumbai. The report highlights Rohit Sharma's leadership in securing the 2024 T20 World Cup and the 2025 Champions Trophy. Furthermore, Vijay Amritraj is recognised for his pioneering role in globalising Indian tennis and his long-standing association with Wimbledon broadcasts. The discussion underscores the immense contribution of these athletes to Indian sports and their status as household names across generations.

T20 World Cup defence loading? India obliterate New Zealand to seal series India laid down a T20 World Cup marker as Abhishek Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav powered an 8-wicket win over New Zealand in Guwahati.

Enough justice: Sanju Samson trolled brutally after poor form continues in 3rd T20I IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Sanju Samson scored a golden duck after Matt Henry dismissed him in the third T20I on Sunday at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati. Samson has averaged only 17 in his last 18 T20I innings.

Abhishek Sharma wreaks havoc in Guwahati, misses guru Yuvraj's record by a whisker IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Abhishek Sharma smashed a 14-ball fifty vs New Zealand in Guwahati, falling just short of Yuvraj Singh's fastest T20I fifty record for India. On the back of his unbeaten 68-run knock, India chased down 154 to win the match by eight wickets.

Dewald Brevis hits heroic 53-ball hundred to lift Pretoria Capitals in final Dewald Brevis put on a one-man show in the SA20 final and smashed a heroic 53-ball hundred to help Pretoria Capitals post a competitive 158 for 7 against Sunrisers Eastern Cape in Cape Town.

Chakravarthy is your main bowler: Rahane slams India's Guwahati T20I playing XI Ajinkya Rahane has called for Team India to avoid excessive changes to its playing XI ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup, questioning the impact of resting key players such as Varun Chakaravarthy during the ongoing series against New Zealand.

Mumbai, Bengal reach knockouts; Madhya Pradesh smash KarnatakaMumbai sealed a nine-wicket win over Hyderabad in Elite Group D to confirm their knockout berth, while Bengal cruised to an innings and 46-run bonus-point victory over Services in Elite Group C to book a quarterfinal spot.

Harshit Rana has Devon Conway's number yet again, thanks to Hardik Pandya's blinderIND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Harshit Rana dismissed Devon Conway for the fifth time on the tour, with Hardik Pandya taking a stunning running catch to give India an early breakthrough in the third T20I at Guwahati.

I'm upset: Djokovic reacts to Sabalenka breaking his grand slam recordAryna Sabalenka surpassed Novak Djokovic's streak for most consecutive tiebreak wins in Grand Slams, prompting a lighthearted yet direct response from the 24-time major champion. Djokovic, who recently advanced to the Australian Open quarterfinals, reacted publicly to Sabalenka's achievement.

Aryna Sabalenka shatters Novak Djokovic's feat, Carlos Alcaraz, Coco Gauff into quartersAryna Sabalenka powered into her fourth straight Australian Open quarter-final while Coco Gauff and Carlos Alcaraz also advanced with composed performances. In contrast, Daniil Medvedev suffered a shock exit as Alcaraz set up a quarter-final clash with Alex de Minaur.

3rd T20I: Bumrah, Bishnoi return as India rest Varun Chakravarthy, ArshdeepIndia made a couple of changes as they look to wrap up the five-match T20I series against New Zealand, bringing back Jasprit Bumrah and Ravi Bishnoi for the third T20I in Guwahati on Sunday. Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy and left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh were rested as part of workload management.

Vijay Amritraj conferred Padma Bhushan; Rohit, Harmanpreet receive Padma ShriVijay Amritraj received the Padma Bhushan, while Rohit Sharma, Harmanpreet Kaur and others were awarded the Padma Shri at the Padma Awards 2026.

Novak Djokovic gets a lucky break, after Jakub Mensik pulls out of Australian OpenAustralian Open: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic has advanced to the quarterfinals of the hard-court major after Jakub Mensik pulled out due to an abdominal muscle injury.

BBL: Perth Scorchers win record sixth title after trouncing Sydney SixersThe Perth Scorchers won their sixth Big Bash League title on Sunday with an emphatic six-wicket victory over Sydney Sixers in the BBL final at Perth Stadium.

3rd T20I Highlights: India lay the smackdown on New Zealand to win seriesIND vs NZ Highlights, 3rd T20I: Abhishek Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav's fifties ensured that India completed the chase in just 10 overs to take an unassailable 3-0 series lead.

Root backs under-fire England coach McCullum: My game has improved tenfold under himJoe Root has jumped to the defence of England coach Brendon McCullum after their underwhelming performance in the Ashes series. McCullum's spot is under serious scrutiny following the loss to Australia.

Wanted to play T20 World Cup but had to follow government's order: BCB directorBangladesh wanted to play T20 World Cup 2026 in India but were forced to withdraw from the tournament due to government orders, revealed Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) Director Abdur Razzak.

Pamela Conti appointed as Indian U-17 women's team head coach before AFC Asian CupThe All India Football Federation (AIFF) has appointed Pamela Conti as the head coach of the Indian U-17 women's national team. The 43-year-old Italian has joined the U-17 women's training camp in Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh, where the Young Tigresses are preparing for the AFC U-17 Women's Asian Cup China 2026, scheduled to begin in April.

Why BCCI is set to remove A+ contracts for players? Devajit Saikia explainsBCCI has decided to remove the A-plus contract category in the upcoming retainership cycle. The A+ category last season included only Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah and Ravindra Jadeja.

Pakistan great Abdul Qadir's son accused of sexual assault by housemaidA housemaid has accused Sulaman Qadir, son of former Pakistan leg-spinner Abdul Qadir, of sexually assaulting her at his farmhouse, following which the police have detained him after an FIR was registered in the case.

Bangladesh Cricket Board reinstates controversial director days after sacking himThe Bangladesh Cricket Board has reinstated controversial director M Najmul Islam as head of the finance committee, just days after removing him from the position following his controversial remarks about Tamim Iqbal and other Bangladesh cricketers.

Bangladesh were misguided by Pakistan, claims ex-cricketer after T20 World Cup exitFormer India cricketer Madan Lal says Bangladesh were misguided by Pakistan leading to their T20 World Cup exit. The ICC replaced Bangladesh with Scotland after the team refused to travel to India citing security concerns.

Australian Open: Learner Tien stuns Daniil Medvedev again in straight-sets winAmerican teenager Learner Tien produced another stunning chapter in his rapidly rising career as he dismantled Daniil Medvedev 6-4, 6-0, 6-3 at the Australian Open on Sunday to reach the quarter-finals of a Grand Slam for the first time.

Nitin Srivastava On Pakistan's U-Turn: PCB Names T20 World Cup Squad After ICC Sanction WarningOn this report, Nitin Srivastava discusses the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) decision to end its boycott threat and name a 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. The shift comes after a stern warning from the ICC regarding potential sanctions, including the loss of PSL contracts and bilateral series. Nitin Srivastava notes, 'Pakistan was never in that kind of mind frame that they will boycott. It was just a threat to tell ICC that we can actually do that.' The transcript highlights that while Pakistan initially backed Bangladesh's protest against travelling to India, the fear of financial and sporting isolation forced a move toward compliance. While Bangladesh has been replaced by Scotland due to their refusal to play in India, Pakistan will play their matches in Colombo. The discussion underscores that the ICC will not tolerate 'petty politics' or moral support for boycotts that lack a valid security basis, ensuring the tournament proceeds with Pakistan's participation.

Bangladesh's exit from T20 World Cup a 'sad moment': World Cricket AssociationThe World Cricket Association (WCA) on Sunday voiced its concern over Bangladesh's exit from the upcoming T20 World Cup, describing it as "a sad moment" that calls for "deep reflection".

Great Expectations: India's Raipur Resurrection Ignites T20 World Cup DreamsIndia's dramatic Raipur chase of 209 transforms cautious hope into intoxicating belief for T20 World Cup glory. Dickens would approve.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
